# dependencytrack_project_policy (Resource)

Manages the assignment of a policy to a project in Dependency-Track. This resource creates a relationship between a project and a policy, enabling policy enforcement for that specific project.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "dependencytrack_project" "web_app" {
  name    = "Web Application"
  version = "1.0.0"
}

resource "dependencytrack_policy" "license_policy" {
  name            = "License Compliance Policy"
  operator        = "ANY"
  violation_state = "FAIL"
}

resource "dependencytrack_project_policy" "web_app_license" {
  policy  = dependencytrack_policy.license_policy.id
  project = dependencytrack_project.web_app.id
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `policy` (String) The UUID of the policy
- `project` (String) The UUID of the project

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of the project policy assignment in the format `policy_uuid/project_uuid`

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Project policy assignments can be imported using the format: policy_uuid/project_uuid
terraform import dependencytrack_project_policy.example 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002
```
